log.input: # Projectile Motion with Air ResistanceA small ball is launched from the ground with an initial velocity \( v_0 \) at an angle \( \theta \) relative to the horizontal. The ball accelerates downward under the influence of gravity. Consider both gravity and air resistance where the resistance force is given by \( f = -b v \).
log.output:
from vpython import *

scene = canvas(title="Projectile Motion with Air Resistance", width=800, height=600)

# Constants
v0 = 20 # initial velocity
theta = radians(30) # launch angle in radians
g = 9.81 # acceleration due to gravity
b = 0.1 # drag coefficient

# Components of initial velocity
vx0 = v0 * cos(theta)
vy0 = v0 * sin(theta)

# Create ball object
ball = sphere(pos=vector(0, 0, 0), radius=1, color=color.blue, make_trail=True)

# Time step and total time
dt = 0.01
t = 0

while ball.pos.y >= 0:
    rate(100)
    
    # Calculate air resistance force
    v = sqrt(ball.velocity.x**2 + ball.velocity.y**2)
    f_air = -b * v * ball.velocity.norm()
    
    # Calculate net force
    f_net = vector(0, -9.81, 0) + f_air
    
    # Update velocity
    ball.velocity += f_net * dt
    
    # Update position
    ball.pos += ball.velocity * dt
    
    t += dt

from vpython import *

scene = canvas(title="Projectile Motion with Air Resistance", width=800, height=600)

# Constants
v0 = 20 # initial velocity
theta = radians(30) # launch angle in radians
g = 9.81 # acceleration due to gravity
b = 0.1 # drag coefficient

# Components of initial velocity
vx0 = v0 * cos(theta)
vy0 = v0 * sin(theta)

# Create ball object
ball = sphere(pos=vector(0, 0, 0), radius=1, color=color.blue, make_trail=True, velocity=vector(vx0, vy0, 0))

# Time step and total time
dt = 0.01
t = 0

while ball.pos.y >= 0:
    rate(100)
    
    # Calculate air resistance force
    v = sqrt(ball.velocity.x**2 + ball.velocity.y**2)
    f_air = -b * v * ball.velocity.hat
    
    # Calculate net force
    f_net = vector(0, -9.81, 0) + f_air
    
    # Update velocity
    ball.velocity += f_net * dt
    
    # Update position
    ball.pos += ball.velocity * dt
    
    t += dt
